intro: Citharexylum endlichii, commonly known as the velvetleaf sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural applications.
